meanings.definition: A firm decision to do or not to do something.
meanings.sent1: After much thought, she made a resolution to exercise every day.
meanings.sent2: His resolution to quit smoking was finally successful.
meanings.sent3: His resolution to eat only vegetables for a month made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her resolution to be kind to everyone shone brightly in her actions.
meanings.sent5: The resolution to save money for a vacation was a motivating goal.

meanings.definition: The action of solving a problem, dispute, or contentious matter.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful resolution of the conflict brought relief to both parties.
meanings.sent2: The resolution of the puzzle required careful thinking.
meanings.sent3: Their resolution to decide who gets the last cookie turned into a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The resolution of the mystery left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The resolution of the math problem was a satisfying achievement.

meanings.definition: The quality of being determined or resolute.
meanings.sent1: Her resolution to succeed in her studies was unwavering.
meanings.sent2: His resolution in pursuing his dreams inspired others.
meanings.sent3: Their resolution to climb the mountain despite the rain showed their determination.
meanings.sent4: The resolution in her eyes reflected her strong will.
meanings.sent5: The resolution in his voice conveyed his determination clearly.

meanings.definition: The smallest interval measurable by a scientific (especially optical) instrument; the degree of sharpness of an image or sound.
meanings.sent1: The camera's high resolution captured every detail of the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The screen resolution of the new phone made images appear crisp.
meanings.sent3: The resolution of the microscope allowed for precise examination of cells.
meanings.sent4: The high resolution of the telescope revealed distant stars clearly.
meanings.sent5: The resolution of the monitor made watching movies a delightful experience.
